description: Build a comprehensive developer platform with Git hosting, code review, CI/CD pipelines, and team collaboration - following GitHub's proven developer-first architecture.

frontend.rationale: GitHub uses React with their own Primer design system. TypeScript ensures code quality at enterprise scale.

backend.rationale: GitHub's proven architecture: Rails for web layer, Go for Git operations and high-performance services.

database.rationale: Multi-database architecture: PostgreSQL for relational data, MySQL for Git metadata, Redis for caching and queues.

git.rationale: Custom Git server implementation for performance, security, and feature control. libgit2 for Git operations.

cicd.rationale: Container-based CI/CD with Kubernetes orchestration. GitHub Actions provides workflow automation.

search.rationale: Advanced code search across repositories. Elasticsearch for general search, specialized tools for code intelligence.

questions.text: What type of developer platform will you build?

choices.label: Git hosting with basic collaboration (GitLab Core style)
choices.impact: Git server, basic UI, simple user management

choices.label: Full developer platform (GitHub style)
choices.impact: Advanced features, CI/CD, project management, marketplace

choices.label: Enterprise developer platform (GitHub Enterprise style)
choices.impact: SSO, audit logs, compliance, advanced security features

choices.label: Specialized platform (specific language/framework)
choices.impact: Custom tooling, language-specific features, targeted integrations

questions.impact: Determines platform complexity, feature set, and target market

questions.text: What scale of Git operations do you need to support?

choices.label: Small teams (up to 100 repositories)
choices.impact: Simple Git server, basic performance optimization

choices.label: Growing organizations (100-10K repositories)
choices.impact: Git server clustering, advanced caching, performance monitoring

choices.label: Enterprise scale (10K+ repositories)
choices.impact: Distributed Git architecture, advanced optimization, global replication

questions.impact: Affects Git server architecture, performance requirements, and infrastructure needs

questions.text: How advanced should your CI/CD capabilities be?

choices.label: Basic CI/CD (simple build and test)
choices.impact: Basic workflow engine, simple job execution

choices.label: Advanced CI/CD (matrix builds, environments)
choices.impact: Complex workflow engine, environment management, artifact storage

choices.label: Enterprise CI/CD (compliance, security scanning)
choices.impact: Security integrations, compliance reporting, audit trails

choices.label: No CI/CD (Git hosting only)
choices.impact: Simplified architecture, focus on Git and collaboration features

questions.impact: Determines CI/CD infrastructure complexity and feature development priority

questions.text: What collaboration features do you need?
questions.impact: Affects UI complexity, database schema, and feature development timeline

questions.text: Do you need enterprise features like SSO, audit logs, and advanced security?
questions.impact: Requires enterprise authentication, logging infrastructure, and security compliance features
